name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ["Four siblings draw their wealth from Charoen Pokphand Group, one of the world's largest producers of animal feed and livestock.", 'Their father Chia Ek Chor, along with his brother Choncharoen Chiaravanont, opened a shop selling seeds imported from China to Thai farmers in 1921. ', "Dhanin Chearavanont, the youngest (pictured above), was CP's chairman and CEO for 48 years until he stepped down in 2017 but remains senior chairman.", "Dhanin's eldest son, Soopakij, and the youngest, Suphachai, are CP's chairman and CEO, respectively.", "In March 2020, CP Group made a successful $10.6 billion bid to acquire Tesco's operations in Thailand and Malaysia. "]
abouts: ["Following the COVID-19 pandemic, the group has invested $3 million in a factory to produce 3 million face masks per month. It's also providing food to 40 hospitals.", "Dhanin's daughter,Thippaporn, runs real estate firm Magnolia Quality Development.\r\n", 'The group has donated $29 million to various initiatives to tackle the Covid-19 pandemic in Thailand.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ['Chalerm Yoovidhya heads a sprawling clan that co-owns Red Bull, the iconic energy drink, which sold 7.5 billion cans across 171 countries in 2019. ', "The family's stake includes a small stake owned personally by Chalerm, eldest son of Red Bull cofounder, the late Chaleo. ", 'Red Bull Thailand is embroiled in a trademark fight with Red Bull in China.', 'Chalerm also owns a vineyard called Siam Winery, which he founded in 1986.']
abouts: ["Chalerm's son Vorayuth, who faces an arrest warrant for his alleged involvement in a fatal hit-and-run case going back to 2012, is a fugitive.", "Chalerm has reportedly commissioned a chalet in Japan's Mount Niseko Annupuri, a popular ski resort area."]

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ["Son of a Bangkok street vendor, Charoen Sirivadhanabhakdi controls Thai Beverage, Thailand's largest brewer, known for its Chang beer.", 'Other big assets include Singapore beverage and property giant Fraser & Neave.', "Charoen's retail empire includes hypermarket chain Big C Supercenter, acquired in 2016 for more than $6 billion.\r\n", 'Charoen listed his privately-held property unit, Asset World Corp, in October 2019 but continues to hold a majority stake.']
abouts: ["Charoen's son Panote, who looks after the property interests, is overseeing One Bangkok, a $3.5 billion mixed-use development in the heart of Bangkok.", 'Charoen took Thai Bev public in Singapore in 2006 after attempts to list in Thailand were derailed by protests against the promotion of alcohol. ']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ["The Chirathivat family controls Central Group, the country's biggest mall developer.", "The group is led by Tos Chirathivat (pictured above), grandson of the group's founder.", "In February 2020, the family listed their private retail arm, Central Retail, raising $2.5 billion in what was Thailand's biggest IPO. ", "E-commerce site, JD Central, is a $560 million joint venture with China's JD.com. "]
abouts: ["In 1927 Tos' grandfather Tiang Chirathivat, a poor emigrant from China, set up his first shop in Bangkok, named Keng Seng Lee.", "In 1956, founder Tiang's son Samrit opened the country's first department store, in the Wang Burapha neighborhood of Bangkok."]

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ["Sarath Ratanavadi is the CEO of Gulf Energy Development, Thailand's third-largest energy producer. \t\r\n", "He took the company public in 2017 raising more than $700 million, in what was the country's biggest IPO in a decade.", 'Shares of Gulf Energy Development, in which he has a significant stake, have soared since its IPO. \t', 'In 2019, revenue was up two-thirds to $1billion as new gas-fired power projects came online. ', "Gulf Energy has a 70:30 joint venture with state-owned oil and gas firm PTT to build a $1.3 billion LNG terminal and port on Thailand's east coast."]
abouts: ['He went to college in Bangkok, then moved to the U.S. for a masters degree in engineering.', 'Sarath is the former managing director of Thailand Golf Championship.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ["Aiyawatt Srivaddhanaprabha is the son of Thailand's late duty-free tycoon, Vichai Srivaddhanaprabha, who died in a helicopter crash in October 2018.", "With estimated annual revenue of  $3.2 billion, King Power,  is the country's leading operator of airport duty-free stores. ", "The company is now run by Aiyawatt (Top), who's King Power's chairman and CEO and shares his fortune with his mother and three siblings.", 'Aiyawatt also chairs Leicester City, the English football club his family bought and turned into one of the best performing clubs in the league. ', "They also own a major chunk of MahaNakhon, a Bangkok development that has Thailand's tallest skyscraper."]
abouts: ['Vichai started King Power in 1989 with a duty-free shop in downtown Bangkok.', "The country's late, revered King Bhumibol Adulyadej, gave Vichai Srivaddhanaprabha his surname. It was originally Raksriaksorn. "]

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ["Prachak Tangkaravakoon chairs $520 million (revenue) TOA Paint (Thailand), the country's biggest paint company. ", 'TOA Paint has three plants in Thailand, plus factories in Vietnam, Laos, Myanmar, Malaysia, Cambodia and Indonesia.', "The company's IPO in 2017 raised $360 million to ramp up regional expansion, including in Myanmar and Cambodia.", 'His fortune got a boost after son Vonnarat completed a backdoor listing deal of cable and wire firm Stark Corporation, in 2019.\r\n', "Son Jatuphat is in charge of TOA Paint and Erawan Sugar. Son Nattavuth runs the family's investment arm, TOA Venture Holding."]
abouts: ["In 1964, Prachak expanded the family's hardware business into paint supplies, opening the first paint factory in 1972.", 'The tycoon long ago handed over operations to his four children.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ["The Osathanugrah family owns 129-year-old Osotspa, among Thailand's oldest companies and maker of the popular M-150 energy drink.", "The family's wealth got a boost from the October 2018 IPO of Osotspa, which is run by Petch Osathanugrah, grandson of the founder.", 'An avid art collector, Petch has built a contemporary art museum in Bangkok.']
abouts: ['Osotspa started in 1891 as a pharmacy selling herbal medicines.', 'Petch also runs the family-founded Bangkok University.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ["Former rice trader Vanich Chaiyawan controls Thai Life, Thailand's third-biggest life insurer.", 'The company is run by his son Chai, who is aiming to make it into a regional brand.', 'Thai Life sells mostly through agents and is known for its emotionally-charged TV commercials. ', "Japan's Meiji Yasuda has a 15% stake in Thai Life.", 'In August 2019, Thai Life entered Myanmar by acquiring a 35% stake in Citizen Business Insurance of Yangon. ']
abouts: ["Vanich also owns a tiny stake in Thai Beverage, fellow billionaire Charoen Sirivadhanabhakdi's Singapore-listed brewer and distiller. ", 'His son, Winyou, who is a banker and novelist, has published two books, The Emptiness of True Love and The Emptiness of Yesterday.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ['Husband and wife, Chuchat Petaumpai and Daonapa Petampai, gave up their bank jobs to start Muangthai Leasing in 1992.', "They grew the company into Thailand's biggest provider of loans against motorcycles with more than 3,200 branches.", "That company's customers include farmers, factory workers and civil servants.", 'The couple took their company public in 2014 and changed its name to Muangthai Capital in 2018.']
abouts: ['Chuchat is an avid wine collector with 2,000 bottles in his private cellar.', 'Their U.S.-educated son, Parithad, works with them.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ["Former surgeon Prasert Prasarttong-Osoth cofounded Bangkok Dusit Medical Services, Thailand's largest private hospital operator, in 1972.", 'Bangkok Dusit has a $370 million luxury healthcare complex in Bangkok that includes a 290-room Movenpick hotel.', 'Prasert also also owns and runs regional airline, Bangkok Airways, which he took public in 2014. ', 'He and daughter Poramaporn resigned after the SEC imposed sanctions against them in January 2019 for allegedly manipulating shares of Bangkok Airways.', 'In a company statement, Prasert said they would prove their innocence through the justice system but subsequently paid a fine.']
abouts: ['PPTV, his digital TV channel, has the rights to broadcast matches of the English Premier League. ', 'Prasert comes from an old Bangkok family that was engaged in making and selling traditional medicines.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ["Harald Link is the third-generation head of Thailand's storied B. Grimm Group, with interests in power, real estate, transport and infrastructure.", "Founded in 1878 as Siam Dispensary, it was acquired by Link's grandfather Adolf Link in 1914.", 'After studying in Switzerland and Germany, where he grew up, Link arrived in Bangkok in 1978 to join his uncle in the family firm. ', 'Chief executive since 1987, Link is grooming daughter Caroline to succeed him. ', "In 2017, Link listed the group's power unit in what was the first ever IPO of a group company."]
abouts: ['Link is an avid polo player.', 'His wife is a titled princess of Liechtenstein. ']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ["Media baron Krit Ratanarak controls Bangkok Broadcasting & TV, which operates Thailand's market leader, Channel 7.", "He also owns a minority stake in Bank of Ayudhya, the country's fifth largest bank.", 'Other assets include a stake in Siam City Cement, which his late father Chuan founded in 1969.', "His U.K.-educated son and only child, Chachchon, oversees the Tonson Group and Tonson Property, the family's investment and property arms."]
abouts: ['Fellow billionaire Harald Link sits on the board of Siam City Cement.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ["Scion of a Thai property clan, Keeree Kanjanapas is the founder and chairman of BTS Group Holdings, operator of Bangkok's famous Skytrain.\r\n", 'His U.K.-educated son, Kavin, has been running BTS since 2015.', 'Making a foray into hotels, BTS acquired Vienna House in 2017 for $350 million, with a string of properties in Europe and Asia.', "Keeree's interests include media firm VGI  and a joint venture with SET-listed developer Sansiri to build condo towers along mass transit lines. ", 'In 2018, VGI expanded into logistics by acquiring a 23% stake in Kerry Express, a parcel delivery firm.']
abouts: ['Before plunging into mass transit, Keeree built a sportswear business in Hong Kong, which owned a Puma franchise.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ["Beer baron Santi Bhirombhakdi controls 86-year-old Boon Rawd Brewery, Thailand's oldest brewery and maker of Singha Beer.", 'Boon Rawd has branched out into backing startups through venture capital arm Singha Ventures.', "The family's property unit, Singha Estate, owns U.K.-based Jupiter Hotels, operator of the Mercure brand, in partnership with FICO Group of the U.K.", 'In 2019, Singha Estate launched Crossroads, an integrated leisure and lifestyle complex in the Maldives.', 'Boon Rawd has a joint venture with Australian logistics firm Linfox to provide road transportation and warehousing services.']
abouts: ['Boon Rawd was set up by his grandfather in 1933. ', 'Singha beer has a mythical lion on its logo.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ['Thaksin Shinawatra, the former prime minister of Thailand, has been living in self-imposed exile in Dubai for more than a decade.', 'He owns a controlling stake in property firm SC Asset, among much else. ', "In 2017, the ruling military junta imposed a retrospective tax on Thaksin's sale of telecom firm Shin Corp's  shares to Singapore's Temasek.", 'His sister Yingluck, also a former prime minister, fled the country in 2017 to escape arrest over a rice subsidy scheme. ', 'In January 2020, Thaksin and Yingluck took part in a consumer electronics show in Las Vegas to promote their new DNA nutrition app.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ['Lawyer-turned-investor Wichai Thongtang, gets the biggest chunk of his fortune from a minority stake in hospital operator Bangkok Dusit. ', "Wichai's portfolio includes TWZ, a distributor of mobile phones and peripheral devices and E For L Aim, a dealer of medical equipment and suppliers.", 'He is chairman of listed Royal Orchid Hotel (Thailand).']
abouts: ['He has represented former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra.', "Wichai's loss-ridden cable-TV company was shut down in August 2016.\r\n"]

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ['Former securities trader Somphote Ahunai started renewable energy outfit Energy Absolute in 2006.', 'He took the company public in 2013 and owns a significant stake with family.', 'Energy Absolute has expanded into energy storage with a $3 billion, 50-gigawatt factory project to make lithium-ion batteries.', 'Its subsidiary, Mine Mobility, unveiled its first electric car, a five-seat hatchback, in June 2019.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ["Electrical engineer Rit Thirakomen chairs and runs MK Restaurant Group known for its value-for-money 'sukiyaki' restaurants.", 'The restaurant chain was founded by his late mother-in-law as a small Thai eatery in 1962.', 'After co-founding a book publishing business in 1974, he took to the restaurant trade in 1987, expanding into sukiyaki with his wife Yupin. ', 'Today, MK has more than 700 restaurants, including Japanese food chain Yayoi.', 'In November 2019, MK acquired a 65% stake in Laem Charoen Seafood Company, a local Thai chain, for $65 million.  ']
abouts: ['At MK Restaurants customers cook their own food in a hotpot at their table.', 'In 2018, MK launched takeaway chain Bizzy Box.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: [" Supaluck Umpujh chairs and runs The Mall Group, the country's second-largest retail chain, founded by her father Supachai Umpujh.", "The family's retail empire includes the hugely popular Siam Paragon mall, The Emporium,   EmQuartier and Bluport Huahin.", 'Supaluck gets her wealth from a majority stake in the retail group, which she shares with her family.', 'The Mall Group has a joint venture with AEG, an American sports and entertainment company, to build two stadiums in Bangkok. ', "Supaluck's niece Ploychompu Umpujh has set up the Escape Bangkok Bar atop EmQuartier. She also has her own fashion brand, Ploychompu Design. "]
abouts: ["Supaluck has a bachelor's degree in pharmacy from Mahidol University, and a master's degree in physical and industrial pharmacy from Purdue University in the U.S.", 'Her father, Supachai Umpujh, built a chain of theatres.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ["Thailand's coffee king Prayudh Mahagitsiri's Quality Coffee Products is a long-standing joint venture with Nestl√©. \r\n", "With a 60% market share, Quality Coffee has been cashing in on the country's rising coffee culture.", 'Prayudh also has interests in steel, copper, shipping, offshore drilling and property development. ', 'His son Chalermchai, a Boston University grad, is CEO of holding outfit PM Group. ', 'Daughter Ausana is the chief operating officer of the PM Group and founder of Coffee Gallery, a chain of cafes.']
abouts: ["Prayudh's grandfather emigrated from southern China to Thailand, where he began trading foodstuffs and later imported Japanese-made tuk-tuks.", "Prayudh sells and markets P80, a food supplement that's made from the Longan fruit.\r\n"]

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ["Along with family, Chatchai Kaewbootta owns a big stake in Srisawad, one of Thailand's largest providers of loans against motorcycles and cars.", 'Srisawad has 3,500 branches and also provides nano-finance loans of under $2,800. ', 'Son of a tractor distributor, he joined the family trade then went on to become a dealer for Honda motorcycles.\r\n', 'Chatchai started the business in 1984, sold to AIG in 2007, but got back into the same business with a new name in 2009.']
abouts: ['Srisawad\'s service slogan is "Mee Baan Mee Rod Ngern Sod Than Jai," which translates to "Your car and/or your home can bring you instant cash."', 'Chatchai named the company after his mother.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ['U.S.-born hotelier William Heinecke came to Thailand as a child and started his first business before he turned 18, hence naming his company Minor.', 'A Thai citizen since 1991, his portfolio has 536 hotels and resorts, more than 2,000 restaurants and 480 retail stores, spread across 65 countries.', "He tripled the size of his hotel portfolio by acquiring Spain's NH Hotels for $2.6 billion in 2018. ", 'Minor also has franchises for such brands as Swensens, Sizzler, Dairy Queen and Burger King. ', "In 2018, Minor celebrated its golden anniversary. In January 2020, Heinecke gave up the CEO's position to a Minor veteran. "]
abouts: ['An auto enthusiast, Heinecke has a collection of 36 cars and motorcycles.', 'In March 2020, he announced the shutdown of his Bangkok hotels in response to the COVID-19 pandemic.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ["Property tycoon Anant Asavabhokhin's biggest asset is a significant stake in SET-listed Land And Houses.", 'He founded the company with his mother, Piangjai Harnpanij, in 1983.', 'Land and Houses bought an apartment building in Campbell, California for $119 million in November 2017.', 'In 2017, he resigned from the chairmanship of four of his companies over his alleged role in a financial scandal linked to the Dhammakaya temple.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ["Civil engineer Thongma Vijitpongpun founded Pruksa in 1993 and built it intoThailand's biggest developer of low-to-middle-income housing.", 'Pruksa, which is known for its affordable prefab townhouses, went public in 2005.', 'In a 2016 restructuring, Thongma delisted Pruksa Real Estate and formed a new holding outfit, Pruksa Holding. ', 'In 2018 Pruksa celebrated its 25th anniversary and moved to a new corporate office in a tower called Pearl Bangkok.']
abouts: ['As a youngster, he helped his father hawk fish-maw soup.\r\n', 'Thongma enjoys reading books on Buddhist philosophy.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ["Indian-born plastics tycoon, Aloke Lohia, is the younger brother of Sri Prakash Lohia, one of Indonesia's richest.", "The Bangkok resident runs $11.4 billion (revenue) Indorama Ventures, the world's largest producer of PET polymer by capacity. ", 'To expand its global footprint, Indorama has been on an acquisition spree with 17 acquisitions since 2014. ', "Bullish on his country of origin, Lohia has a joint venture with India's Dhunseri Petrochem to make polyester resin in eastern India. ", "In January 2020, Indorama Ventures completed the $2 billion acquisition of U.S.- based Huntsman Corporation's chemicals business. "]
abouts: ['Lohia has lunch with his wife, Suchitra, who works with him, nearly every day. ', 'Indorama Ventures has recycled 50 billion PET beverage bottles since 2011 and aims to recycle 50 billion annually by 2025.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ["Isara Vongkusolkit is the chairman of Mitr Phol Sugar, Asia's largest sugar producer.", 'The family also owns coal producer, Banpu, which is chaired by brother Chanin.', "The family's property interests are held through SET-listed Erawan Group, which has 70 hotels under 9 different brands, including Grand Hyatt.", 'His brother Chanin is also chairman of Erawan.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ["Somporn Juangroongruangkit is president of $ 2.6 billion (revenue) Thai Summit Group, one of Thailand's leading auto part makers.", 'Apart from Thailand, the Group has factories in China, India, Indonesia, Japan, Malaysia, USA and Vietnam.', 'Thai Summit is run by her daughter, Chanapun, and son, Sakulthorn.', "Her older son Thanathorn was Thai Summit's executive vice president until 2018, when he decided to plunge into politics."]

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ['Phornthep Phornprapha runs privately held Siam Motors Group, producer of Nissan cars and trucks in Thailand. ', "The family's other interests include auto parts, logistics, construction equipment and hotels. \r\n", "Siam Motors has funded an automotive engineering and development center at Thammasat University's campus in Pattaya. "]
abouts: ['Phornthep has a board seat at Bangkok Bank, controlled by the Sophonpanich family.', 'The company is building a 30-story tower in downtown Bangkok, which is expected to open in 2022.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ["The Viriyahbhun family controls Viriyah Insurance, the country's biggest non-life insurer, specializing in auto insurance. ", 'Lek Viriyahbhun founded the Thonburi Phanich Group in 1941 as a trading outfit.', 'The group got into car distribution with brands such as Mercedes-Benz. ', "After Lek's death in 2000 the fortune was divided among his 6 children. "]
abouts: ['Lek also established the Erawan Museum, south of Bangkok, featuring a giant, three-headed copper elephant.', 'The insurance unit was established in 1947 as a fire and marine insurer that later expanded into car insurance. ']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ["Banthoon Lamsam chairs and runs Kasikorn Bank, or KBank, the nation's second-largest lender with $98 billion in assets. ", 'The bank was founded by his grandfather Choti Lamsam as Thai Farmers Bank in 1945. ', 'Banthoom, a Harvard MBA, took charge from his father in 1992.']
abouts: ['He owns a Swiss-style wooden chalet in a forest, 350 miles north of Bangkok.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ["Sathien Setthasit runs Carabao Group, maker of Thailand's hugely popular Carabao Dang energy drink. ", 'Sathien founded the company in 2002 with his folk singer pal Aed Carabao and took it public in 2014.', 'Aiming to become a global brand and win over Europeans, Carabao has sponsored English Premier League football club Chelsea.', 'His younger son Romtham is assistant managing director at Carabao, while older son, Veeratham, is deputy managing director of retailer CJ Express.']
abouts: ['Carabao, which has close to a fourth of the Thai energy drink market, outsells Red Bull in Thailand.', 'Carabao is the title sponsor of the English Football League. ']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ['Witoon Suriyawanakul is the founder of Siam Global House, a chain of warehouse building materials and DIY home improvement stores.', 'He has a significant stake with his family in the Roi Et based company, which has grown by relying on provincial consumers.', 'Son of mom-and-pop shopkeepers, Witoon studied civil engineering and got start as a contractor.', 'Witoon resigned as CEO in 2016 after being fined by regulators for insider trading, handing over operations to his brother Anavat.', 'Witoon, who has not commented on the charge, was reappointed as CEO a year later.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios:
["Chartsiri Sophonpanich is the president of Bangkok Bank, Thailand's largest lender with 17 million retail customers.", 'His father, Chatri Sophonpanich, was chairman for 18 years until he died in June 2018.
', 'His grandfather, Chin Sophonpanich founded the bank 75 years ago.
', 'The family also has interests spanning property, insurance, transportation, healthcare and construction.
']
abouts: ['Bangkok Bank was the first Thai bank to be listed on the stock exchange in 1975.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ['Chaivat Taepaisitphongse chairs agro-food conglomerate, Betagro Group.', 'Betagro was started in 1967 as a producer and distributor of animal feed.', "The privately held group's products range from livestock to animal feed to branded food products such as eggs and sausages.", "Chaivat's son, Vasit Taepaisitphongse, is the group's president and chief executive.", 'Food products are sold under the S-Pure, Betagro and Itoham brands.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ["Boonchai Bencharongkul is the chairman of Total Access Communications, also known as DTAC, the country's third-largest mobile phone operator. ", 'DTAC is a joint venture with Norwegian telecom firm Telenor Group. ', 'His nephew Pirachai Bencharongkul runs Rakbankerd, an agribusiness outfit that works with farmers.']
abouts: ['Boonchai owns a private museum, which showcases his collection of contemporary Thai sculptures and artworks.', 'He meditates daily.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ['Medical doctor Pongsak Viddayakorn, cofounded hospital operator Bangkok Dusit Medical Services with fellow lister Prasert Prasarttong-Osoth.', 'In 2012, he sold his Bangkok Dusit shares to build a property portfolio through listed outfit Principal Capital, overseen by his son Satit. ', 'In 2017, Principal expanded into healthcare with the acquisition of four hospitals in the northern provinces.\r\n\r\n', 'The company is aiming to grow its healthcare network to 20 hospitals by 2023.']
abouts: ['He supported himself through high school and medical school by selling stationery.', 'Pongsak grew up in the coastal province of Trat, bordering Cambodia and won a scholarship to an elite Bangkok high school.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ['Medical doctor Kumpol Plussind started out with a small infirmary in the heart of an industrial hub east of Bangkok.', 'His SET-listed Chularat Hospital, is today a chain of nine hospitals and four clinics. ', "He and his family own a majority stake Chularat Hospital, which has featured in Forbes Asia's ranking of Best Under A Billion companies"]
abouts: ["Chularat has sponsored Thailand's women's rugby team."]

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ['Nutchamai Thanombooncharoen is the cofounder and managing director of SET-listed Carabao Group, maker of energy drink Carabao Dang.', "Nutchamai branched out from her family's financial-services business to team up with cofounder Sathien Sethasit for a property venture.", 'In 2002, they partnered with popular folk singer Aed Carabao for a foray into energy drinks.', 'Top international markets for Carabao include Cambodia, China, Myanmar, Vietnam and Afghanistan.']
abouts: ['Before Carabao, Nutchamai set up Tawandang German Brewery, a microbrewery and restaurant, in 1999 with Sathien.', 'She co-owns Tawandang Distillery, which makes rice whisky.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ['Former top cop Wirachai Songmetta gets his wealth from SET-listed Absolute Clean Energy, a renewable energy producer.', 'Absolute Clean Energy operates 19 biomass power projects with a combined capacity of 246 megawatts. ', 'Wirachai had interests in distributing hardboard and wood chips before he set up the business. He took it public in 2019.', 'Wirachai graduated from the Police Academy, completed his Ph.d., and climbed the ranks to deputy commissione; he stepped down in September 2020.', 'His ex-wife chairs the company while two of his three sons have board seats.']
abouts: ['Wirachai has said his future goal is to become a monk.', 'The company has 17 projects with a combined capacity of 204 megawatts under development.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ["Nishita Shah is the managing director of her family's 152-year-old GP Group.", 'The group flagship is shipping firm Precious Shipping, set up in 1989. ', "The family's biggest asset today is pharma firm Mega Lifesciences, founded by her father, Kirit.", 'Other assets include a stake in SET- listed Golden Lime, a manufacturer of calcium oxide and calcium hydroxide.']
abouts: ['GP Group has roots in rice trading and was headquartered in Myanmar, then Burma.\r\n', 'Shah was a judge in the Thai version of reality television show Shark Tank.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ["Kraisorn Chansiri chairs $4.2 billion (revenue) Thai Union Group, the world's biggest producer of canned tuna.", 'The company, run by his eldest son Thiraphong, reported a record $200 million in net profit for 2020.', "The U.S. and Europe account for 71% of the company's annual sales. ", 'The company has a $30 million venture fund to invest in food-tech companies. It has invested in BlueNalu, a cell-based seafood company in California.']
abouts: ["Kraisorn worked as a Chinese-language teacher and a trader in rice, liquor and garments before he won a fish broker's license.", 'He cofounded Thai Union in 1977 when he bought a small tuna cannery with his brother and friends.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ['The Maleenont family consists of the heirs of media baron Vichai Maleenont, who died in October 2018 at age 98.\r\n', 'They inherited a 43% stake in BEC World, known for its Channel 3. ', "The company is chaired and run by the late Vichai's younger son Prachum. ", 'Fve members of the Maleenont family sit on the board of BEC World.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ['Low profile investor gets a chunk of his fortune from a valuable stake in listed Krungthai Card. ', 'He is the second largest shareholder after Krungthai Bank, which holds 49%.', "Mongkol's other investments include stakes in Do Day Dream, Beauty Community, Raimon Land and Taokaenoi Food & Marketing."]

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ['Siripong Rungrojkitiyos is the founder of P.C.S. Machine Group Holding, an auto parts maker specializing in power trains.', 'The company counts Toyota, General Motors and Isuzu among its customers.', 'He started the company in 1986 by borrowing the equivalent of $250,000.', "His wife and 3 sons sit on the company's board."]
abouts: ['The initials P.C.S are derived from PongSaiChak, a company Siripong founded early in his career.', "Siripong is a keen golfer and has a golf course next to the company's factory in the northeast."]

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ['Physician Chalerm Harnphanich owns a substantial stake in listed Bangkok Chain Hospital.', 'Chalerm runs the company together with his wife Somporn, daughters Pornluck and Pornsuda and son Kantaporn. ', 'Bangkok Chain has a dozen hospitals in all with 2,245 beds.', 'Chalerm is preparing to open a new hospital in Vietnam in 2020.']
abouts: ['He got his start in 1984 with the 60-bed Kasemrad hospital in Bangkok.']

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ["Worawit Weeraborwornpong is the chairman of Siamgas & Petrochemicals, Thailand's second-largest LPG distributor.", 'Siamgas has a presence overseas, notably in Vietnam, China and Singapore with joint ventures in Indonesia and Myanmar.', "The family's property business, which has such assets as the 788-room Berkeley Hotel Pratunam in Bangkok, is overseen by his daughter Patcharawadee."]
abouts: ['Son of a shophouse owner, who sold charcoal, rice, Worawit founded Siam Gas Industries in 1973.', "His son Supachai is the company's managing director."]

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ["Jareeporn Jarukornsakul is cofounder and chairman of WHA, Thailand's leading warehousing and logistics firm.\r\n", "Jareeporn has been running the company since 2015. In 2017, she listed WHA's renewable energy arm, WHA Utilities & Power. ", 'WHA is setting up an e-commerce park for several e-commerce giants, including, reportedly, for Alibaba.', "WHA has a joint-venture with Gulf, Mitsui, and Tokyo Gas for natural gas distribution in three of the group's industrial estates.", 'In November 2019, she was appointed to the board of Siam Commercial Bank.']
abouts: ['In 2015 she was listed with her then-husband Somyos Anantaprayoon but after their divorce they dropped out as their fortune was divided. ', "Somyos died in February 2018, passing on his shares to their only daughter, whose inheritance is grouped with Jareeporn's assets."]

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios:
["Telecom magnate Pete Bodharamik controls Jasmine International, Thailand's second-largest broadband service provider.
", 'The company was started by his father in 1982 but got thrown into bankruptcy after the 1997 financial crisis.\r\n', 'He took over Jasmine in 2008, reviving the company with a broadband push into underserved provinces.\r\n', 'He also chairs Mono Technology, operator of digital TV channel, Mono29.']
abouts: ['In 2015 he bid a record $2 billion for 4G spectrum but failed to to secure funds to pay for it.', "A fitness buff, Bodharamik posts his weight and that of Jasmine's top executives in a corner of the company dining room for all to see."]

name: Thailand's 50 Richest
bios: ['Chansamorn Wattanavekin chairs the storied Kiatnakin Group, founded by husband Kiat Wattanavekin, who died in 2013 at the age of 105.', 'Her oldest son Supol is the chairman of Kiatnakin Bank.', "The family's other key holdings include privately owned Eastern Sugar.", 'The family also has a stake in listed property firm Erawan Group along with sugar rival Isara Vongusolkit.']
